Wattson's New Home on the Corner of 4th and Hertz!

Wattson's Restaurant

Wattson's Restaurant was founded in 1879 by the famous Benjamin Franklin. After his kite was struck by lightning, Franklin had the idea to open an American Eatery that would charge up the city of Philadelphia. The famous menu of American staples has been feeding the city and shocking the culinary world since the Libery Bell was cracked. Come try our award winning Cheese Steak, or our famous Tesla Coil Fries. Then before you go make sure to stop by our in house bakery for a recharging dessert! We look forward to seeing you at our new address at the corner of 4th and Hertz!

4444 Hertz Avenue

Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 19092

641-720-1879
